org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor
Class SkelOptor

java.lang.Object
  org.edg.data.replication.optorsim.optor.SkelOptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Optimisable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ReplicatingOptimiser, SimpleOptimiser
public class SkelOptor
extends java.lang.Object
implements Optimisable

This class is the basic implementation of the Optimisable interface. It provides the basic operations required for all the optimisation classes and simple versions of the two most important methods: getAccessCost() and getBestFile(). getAccessCost() calculates the expected cost to access the specified files from the specified ComputingElement using network information to work out the best replica to use for each file in terms of network latencies.

getBestFile() uses the same network information to return, for each file given, the replica that can be accessed from the Computing Element calling the method in the quickest time. This class should not be instantiated itself, but subclasses should be used which overload the methods as required.

Copyright (c) 2004 CERN, ITC-irst, PPARC, on behalf of the EU DataGrid. For license conditions see LICENSE file or http://www.edg.org/license.html

Since:
JDK1.4

Method Detail

getBestFile

public DataFile[] getBestFile(java.lang.String[] lfns,
                              float[] fileFraction)
A "standard" implementation of getBestFile. It simply looks at the Replica Catalogue and current network status and returns the replicas that will take the shortest time to access.

Specified by:
getBestFile in interface Optimisable
Parameters:
lfns - The name of the files the CE needs to access.
fileFraction - The fraction of each file the CE uses. This can be important in deciding whether it is better to replicate a file or read it remotely.
Returns:
The DataFiles the CE will access.

getAccessCost

public float getAccessCost(java.lang.String[] lfns,
                           ComputingElement ce,
                           float[] fileFraction)
Calculate aggregated network costs for a single computing element. Uses network costs and the Replica Catalog to find the best replica of each file and sums the access costs.

Specified by:
getAccessCost in interface Optimisable
Parameters:
lfns - The names of the files required for the job.
ce - The Computing Element for which the access cost is calculated.
fileFraction - The fractions of each file required for the job.
Returns:
The cost in terms of time to access all the best replicas needed for the job.
